reference.scope: CHARACTERIZATION OF VARIANT MPS7 ASN-350 LEU-577

comment.text: Plays an important role in the degradation of dermatan and keratan sulfates.
A beta-D-glucuronoside + H(2)O = D-glucuronate + an alcohol.
N-linked glycosylated with 3 to 4 oligosaccharide chains.

disease.name: Mucopolysaccharidosis 7
disease.description: An autosomal recessive lysosomal storage disease characterized by inability to degrade glucuronic acid-containing glycosaminoglycans. The phenotype is highly variable, ranging from severe lethal hydrops fetalis to mild forms with survival into adulthood. Most patients with the intermediate phenotype show hepatomegaly, skeletal anomalies, coarse facies, and variable degrees of mental impairment.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.
Belongs to the glycosyl hydrolase 2 family.

feature.description: Functional polymorphism with no clinical consequences; reduced activity levels; dbSNP:rs149606212.
In MPS7; loss of activity; dbSNP:rs121918183.
In MPS7; very mild phenotype; dbSNP:rs777613366.
